topic.title: HPE Helion 2.0 Development Platform: Increasing Trove Internal Quotas

body.p: It is possible to exceed the Trove internal quotas when creating new client databases in a tenant. Follow this procedure to increase the Trove quotas for that tenant.You may see the terms HPE Helion OpenStack "deployer" and "lifecycle manager" used interchangeably. These terms refer to the same node in your environment.

ol.li: Log in to the lifecycle manager for your HPE Helion OpenStack environment with admin privileges.

Obtain the credentials for the Admin tenant.nova credentialsThe output should look similar to the following:+------------------+--------------------------------------+ | User Credentials | Value | +------------------+--------------------------------------+ | domain | {"id": "default", "name": "Default"} | | id | bb3252a8ea6b3223841783e11bd3e7dc | | name | admin | +------------------+--------------------------------------+ +-----------+----------------------------------+ | Token | Value | +-----------+----------------------------------+ | expires | 2015-12-01T04:27:18.160125Z | | id | 80eaa95d334a443b9b111f7fcca49cae | | tenant_id | bb3252a8ea6b3223841783e11bd3e7dc | | user_id | bb4472a716b4424840293c30ed558eb | +-----------+----------------------------------+
Make a note of the id value in the Token table. You will need it for the value of <AUTH_TOKEN>.
Make a note of the tenant_id value in the Token table. You will need it for the value of <ADMIN_TENANT_ID>.

Retrieve a list of all available tenants.openstack project list The output should look similar to the following:+----------------------------------+---------------+ | ID | Name | +----------------------------------+---------------+ | 09d7cee37100437a95a8144a4a7192e6 | services | | 0fdce261684a4ec8b1b6e81806acbfdb | admin | | 33693127f9bb42348d959eef7ff8b307 | backup | | 5becfbcda5a04297bc7a8c7fe5ba17f8 | demo | | a6315a51d99947ddbed2d1b8b804d194 | swift-monitor | | bf869aef7ce14775a60dcbc0ce77db58 | glance-swift | +----------------------------------+---------------+Make a note of the ID value of the target tenant. You will need it for the value of <TENANT_ID>.

Execute the command openstack endpoint list | grep databaseThe output should look similar to the following:+----------------------------------+---------+--------------+---------------+---------+-----------+-------------------------------+ | ID | Region | Service Name | Service Type | Enabled | Interface | URL | +----------------------------------+---------+--------------+---------------+---------+-----------+-------------------------------+ | 022e5ea163e22697a8c04f443ccad119 | region1 | trove | database | True | internal | http://10.12.111.123:8070 | ...Make a note of the URL value. You will need it for the value of <SERVICE_URL>.

Run the curl command to update the Trove quota for the target tenant. The command uses the following format:curl -i <SERVICE_URL>:8779/v1.0/<ADMIN_TENANT_ID>/mgmt/quotas/<TENANT_ID> -X PUT -H "X-Auth-Project-Id: <ADMIN_TENANT_ID>" -H "User-Agent: python-troveclient" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "Accept: application/json" -H "X-Auth-Token: <AUTH_TOKEN>" -d '{"quotas": {"instances": <INSTANCEQUOTA>, "backups": <BACKUPQUOTA>, "volumes": <VOLUMEQUOTA>}}'Provide values for the <SERVICE_URL>, <ADMIN_TENANT_ID> <TENANT_ID>, and <AUTH_TOKEN> from the values retrieved previously. Provide the updated values for <INSTANCEQUOTA>, <BACKUPQUOTA> and <VOLUMEQUOTA> as appropriate for your environment. For example: curl -i 'https://mycloud.example.com:8779/v1.0/bb3252a8ea6b3223841783e11bd3e7dc/mgmt/quotas/5becfbcda5a04297bc7a8c7fe5ba17f8' -X PUT -H "X-Auth-Project-Id: bb3252a8ea6b3223841783e11bd3e7dc" -H "User-Agent: python-troveclient" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "Accept: application/json" -H "X-Auth-Token: 80eaa95d334a443b9b111f7fcca49cae" -d '{"quotas": {"instances": 1000, "backups": 1000, "volumes": 10000}}'The port number is not a variable; this value must be 8779.

When the command finishes, you should see output similar to the following, indicating the command has successfully updated the quotas.HTTP/1.1 200 OK Content-Type: application/json Content-Length: 66 Date: Tue, 01 Dec 2015 20:09:14 GMT {"quotas": {"instances": 1000, "backups": 1000, "volumes": 10000} }
